ticket.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions
ticket.original-body:
I've just updated to rails 2.3 and I found that calling flash from the view triggers the lazy sessions. I think this is not the expected behavior.
Simple patch:
Index: rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb =================================================================== --- rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb (revision 1051) +++ rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb (working copy) @@ -152,7 +152,11 @@ # to put a new one. def flash #:doc: unless defined? @_flash - @_flash = session["flash"] ||= FlashHash.new + if session.send(:loaded?) + @_flash = session["flash"] ||= FlashHash.new + else + @_flash = FlashHash.new + end @_flash.sweep end
ticket.latest-body:
I've just updated to rails 2.3 and I found that calling flash from the view triggers the lazy sessions. I think this is not the expected behavior.
Simple patch:
Index: rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb =================================================================== --- rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb (revision 1051) +++ rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb (working copy) @@ -152,7 +152,11 @@ # to put a new one. def flash #:doc: unless defined? @_flash - @_flash = session["flash"] ||= FlashHash.new + if session.send(:loaded?) + @_flash = session["flash"] ||= FlashHash.new + else + @_flash = FlashHash.new + end @_flash.sweep end
ticket.original-body-html:
I've just updated to rails 2.3 and I found that calling flash from the view triggers the lazy sessions. I think this is not the expected behavior.

Simple patch:

Index: rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb

--- rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb (revision 1051) +++ rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/flash.rb (working copy) @@ -152,7 +152,11 @@

     # to put a new one.
     def flash #:doc:
       unless defined? @_flash


  •      @_flash = session["flash"] ||= FlashHash.new


  •     if session.send(:loaded?)


  •       @_flash = session["flash"] ||= FlashHash.new


  •     else


  •       @_flash = FlashHash.new


  •     end
     @_flash.sweep
   end

version.body:
I've just updated to rails 2.3 and I found that calling flash from the view triggers the lazy sessions. I think this is not the expected behavior.
See the patch attached
version.body-html:
I've just updated to rails 2.3 and I found that calling flash from the view triggers the lazy sessions. I think this is not the expected behavior.

See the patch attached
version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body: Any comments on this ticket? I realized the same thing when trying to cache my application with varnish. As flash triggers the session and sets the "Set-Cookie" header although the session is empty varnish is not willing to cache the page.
version.body-html: Any comments on this ticket? I realized the same thing when trying to cache my application with varnish. As flash triggers the session and sets the "Set-Cookie" header although the session is empty varnish is not willing to cache the page.
version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body: Maybe we need to lobby a little for this?
version.body-html: Maybe we need to lobby a little for this?
version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body:
Check out this plugin: http://github.com/msales/smart_cookie_store
It enhances the default `CookieStore` by preventing `Set-Cookie` headers for empty sessions.
version.body-html:
Check out this plugin: http://github.com/msales/smart_cookie_store

It enhances the default CookieStore by preventing Set-Cookie headers for empty sessions.
version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body-html:

version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body: It is related. How did you fix it? The fix for #3811 isn't enough.
version.body-html: It is related. How did you fix it? The fix for #3811 isn't enough.
version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body:
I had a look and it's not fixed in the latest 2-3-stable. Attached is a diff that contains a test and possible fix (but the fix breaks the reset session functionality). To recap, the problem is that even when you only try to access something in the session (like for example a `flash[:notice]` in the layout) a session cookie gets set. Even if it is empty and there's no need for it.
I'm not quite sure about Rails 3, but the bug seems to be present there, too.
version.body-html:
I had a look and it's not fixed in the latest 2-3-stable. Attached is a diff that contains a test and possible fix (but the fix breaks the reset session functionality). To recap, the problem is that even when you only try to access something in the session (like for example a flash[:notice] in the layout) a session cookie gets set. Even if it is empty and there's no need for it.

I'm not quite sure about Rails 3, but the bug seems to be present there, too.
version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body: BTW, sorry for the typo in the test case ;)
version.body-html: BTW, sorry for the typo in the test case ;)
version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body: I just tested it and the bug is still present in Rails 2.3 (latest version of the branch) and in master. However in master my fix doesn't work (even after the obvious changes necessary to have a look).
version.body-html: I just tested it and the bug is still present in Rails 2.3 (latest version of the branch) and in master. However in master my fix doesn't work (even after the obvious changes necessary to have a look).
version.title: ActionController::Flash::InstanceMethods::flash triggers the lazy sessions

version.body: Fixed on master. When #4938 is backported, this will be fixed as well.
version.body-html: Fixed on master. When #4938 is backported, this will be fixed as well.
